### 1️⃣ What the theorem is saying (in plain language)

For any right‑angled triangle:

\[
\text{(length of the longest side)}^{2}= \text{(length of one short side)}^{2}+ \text{(length of the other short side)}^{2}
\]

- The **longest side** (the side opposite the right angle) is called the **hypotenuse** – that’s the side we label **c**.  
- The other two sides that form the right angle are **a** and **b**.

So the formula is simply  

\[
c^{2}=a^{2}+b^{2}
\]
